meanings.definition: Not acquainted or familiar with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She felt unacquainted with the new student in class.
meanings.sent2: The traveler was unacquainted with the local customs.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed unacquainted with the concept of personal space.
meanings.sent4: His mind was unacquainted with the idea of failure.
meanings.sent5: The forest was unacquainted with the sound of laughter.

meanings.definition: Not having knowledge or experience of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The young child was unacquainted with the taste of sushi.
meanings.sent2: She was unacquainted with the history of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent3: The robot appeared unacquainted with the concept of emotions.
meanings.sent4: His heart was unacquainted with the feeling of betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The painting was unacquainted with the touch of sunlight.
